result.execSummary:
The defendant Alexis Marie Moen was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Conditions: Attend, pay for, and successfully complete any programming ordered by the department; obey all rules and regulations of the department. Submit to alcohol and/or drug programming or counseling as directed by the agent. Do not consume any alcohol. Do not possess or consume any prescription medications without a valid prescription. Take all prescribed medications exactly as prescribed. 0 days credit for time served. Court costs waived.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Alexis Marie Moen

defendant.name: Moen, Alexis Marie
defendant.address: 119 S. Stewart St., Richland Center, WI 53581

records.addlTxt: 11:05 a.m. Appearances: Defendant Alexis Marie Moen in court. Attorney Julie A Dadoun in court for Alexis Marie Moen. Attorney Jennifer M. Harper in court for State of Wisconsin. Called together: 21CM109, 21CM143, 21CM144, 21CM145, 22CM4. Parties' agreement for resolution stated, calling for Def's pleas to count 1/bail jumping in 21CM145, count 1/bail jumping in 22CM4, and count 1/OWI 2nd in 21CM144; probation disposition recommended. Def pleads guilty to the three counts stated. Court orders remaining counts/cases DRI except for count 2 of 21CM144 which is being dismissed outright with the reasons for that dismissal laid out on the record and relating to a deficiency in the criminal complaint. Court withholds sentence and places Def on 2 years probation, concurrent. For the OWI 2nd, the sentence structure is imposed/stayed rather than "withheld." OWI 2nd sentence is ordered per guidelines at .19. Sentence for the OWi is 30 days jail with 5 days imposed; remainder of the days stayed; Def will not serve the rest if successful on probation. Additionally, for the OWI, the sentence will include $450 plus costs for a total of $1555. Revocation: 16 mo. IID: 16 months upon relicensing. AODA/driver safety plan to be relicensed. Additional conditions: alcohol and other drug treatment. No consumption of alcohol. No possession/consumption of prescription meds without valid prescriptions. Submit to treatment/programming as recommended by agent. Credit for time served: 0 days. For the 5 days jail to be served as a mandatory part of the OWI 2nd conviction, Def to begin those days on or before May 20th, with Huber and 0 days credit.

3:30 PM 21CM145/ 21CM143/21CM144/22/CM04/21CM109Defendant Alexis Marie Moen in court.  Attorney Jennifer M. Harper in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Julie A Dadoun in court for Alexis Marie Moen. Attorney Harper asks for a set over and notes that we can set for a plea and sentencing.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for April 18, 2022 at 11:00 am.

2:47 PM  22CM04/21CM143/21CM145/21CM109/21CM144 - Defendant Alexis Marie Moen appeared by phone.  Attorney Jennifer M. Harper appeared by video for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Julie A Dadoun in court for Alexis Marie Moen. Attorney Harper asks for a short reset and notes that AM will be coming home today. Attorney Dadoun states that AM will be staying at the Ramada Inn.
Status conference scheduled for April 11, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
Status conference on April 6, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Status conference on April 6, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

01:34 PM Attorney Julie A Dadoun appeared by video means for Defendant Alexis Marie Moen. Attorney Jennifer M. Harper appeared by video means for Plaintiff State of Wisconsin. Defendant Alexis Marie Moen not in court. Atty. Dadoun states that the Def has been picked up in Tennessee; Atty. Dadoun asks that she be allowed to appear by authorization for this appearance; also asks that she be allowed to meet with the Def as Dadoun is presently about 45 minutes from Def's location. DA Harper - State asks for warrant - statewide - for Def's non-appearance today. Court notes Atty. Dadoun does have authorization on file; does not issue warrant; resets matters to 4/6 at 2 p.m. DA Harper requests that be in person. Court orders 4/6 to be in person.  Status conference scheduled for April 6, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Status conference on March 31, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

09:05 AM 21CM109/21CM143/21CM144/21CM145/22CM4 - Attorney Julie A Dadoun appeared by video means for Defendant Alexis Marie Moen. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin. Defendant Alexis Marie Moen appeared by phone means. Attorney Dadoun states that she has received an offer but has met with AM about the offer. Attorney Dadoun states that we could set this for a plea and sentencing.  Status conference scheduled for March 31, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Status conference on February 10, 2022 at 09:00 am.

11:02 AM Defendant Alexis Marie Moen appeared by phone means for status in several cases and adjourned initial in 22CM4. Attorney Julie A Dadoun appeared by video means for Defendant Alexis Marie Moen. Attorney Jennifer M. Harper appeared by video means for Plaintiff State of Wisconsin. Initial appearance completed in 22CM4. Charges and penalties stated. NG pleas entered. Further status requested and set in all matters; parties working towards resolution.  Status conference scheduled for February 10, 2022 at 09:00 am.

records.addlTxt: While the case is pending, Defendant to pay $50/month to the Clerk of Court. At the end of the case, Defendant will be required to fully reimburse Richland County. Failure to pay will result in collection actions by the clerk.
Adjourned initial appearance on January 28, 2022 at 11:00 am.

01:15 PM Defendant Alexis Marie Moen appeared by phone means. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Dadoun appears for AM and states that she is appointed to the other cases. Court appoints Attorney Dadoun. Atty Dadoun hasn't been able to review the complaint.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for January 28, 2022 at 11:00 am.
